label: Multi-Platform Order Aggregation (DoorDash, Uber Eats)
description: Unified order management consolidating DoorDash, Uber Eats, and Grubhub into single kitchen workflow reducing errors by 70-85% and improving efficiency 40-60% through centralized orchestration.

traditional.workflow: 1. Three separate tablets ring simultaneously: DoorDash, Uber Eats, Grubhub. 2. Staff must monitor all tablets and manually accept orders. 3. Orders manually re-entered into POS or kitchen system. 4. No unified queue - staff prioritizes based on which tablet they notice first. 5. 12-18% order errors from manual re-entry.
constraints: 3+ tablets creates chaos and missed orders
12-18% errors from manual re-entry
No unified prioritization (FIFO across platforms impossible)
Staff overwhelmed monitoring multiple tablets
Orders missed when tablet notification not heard
Kitchen sees fragmented view not unified queue

agentic.workflow: 1. Order Aggregation Agent automatically receives orders from all platforms via API integration. 2. Unified Queue consolidates orders into single KDS stream with platform identifier. 3. Auto-Accept accepts orders within SLA (no manual tablet monitoring). 4. Priority Engine sequences orders by promise time and prep complexity. 5. Single Workflow eliminates re-entry: orders flow directly to kitchen stations with all customizations.
dataSources: Uber Eats order stream via API
Platform SLA requirements (accept within X minutes)
Order promise times and pickup deadlines
benefits: 40-60% efficiency improvement (no tablet monitoring, no re-entry)
Unified queue enables proper FIFO sequencing
Staff focus on cooking not order management
Single KDS view for all delivery orders

quickWins: Implement API integration for top 2 platforms
Consolidate orders into single KDS view

label: Menu Synchronization Across Platforms
description: Real-time menu updates pushed to all delivery platforms simultaneously reducing out-of-stock frustration by 90-95% and enabling instant menu changes across ecosystem.

traditional.workflow: 1. Chicken nuggets sell out at 6pm. 2. Staff must manually update DoorDash tablet, then Uber Eats tablet, then Grubhub tablet (8-15 min process). 3. Orders continue coming in during update lag. 4. Customer receives 'Item unavailable' notification after ordering (poor experience). 5. Price changes require manual update to 3+ platforms (forgotten or inconsistent).
constraints: 8-15 min lag to update all platforms manually
Orders placed for unavailable items during lag
Price inconsistencies across platforms
Promotions can't run simultaneously across platforms
New menu rollouts require 3x effort
30-40% of out-of-stock notifications preventable with real-time updates

agentic.workflow: 1. Menu Management Agent maintains single source of truth for menu: items, prices, descriptions, availability. 2. Real-Time Sync pushes updates to all platforms via API within 30 seconds: '86 chicken nuggets' â†’ all platforms updated instantly. 3. Availability Automation integrates with POS inventory: when last nugget sold, auto-86 across platforms. 4. Pricing Consistency ensures promotional pricing synchronized across all channels. 5. New Item Rollout publishes to all platforms with single click.
benefits: Automated inventory sync eliminates manual updates

label: Delivery Partner Performance Tracking
description: Real-time courier performance monitoring with automated escalation reducing late deliveries by 40-60% and improving customer satisfaction through proactive issue resolution.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer complains food arrived cold and 45 minutes late. 2. Restaurant has no visibility into what happened during delivery. 3. Restaurant can't identify if courier, traffic, or other issue. 4. No way to rate or track individual courier performance. 5. Same courier assigned to future orders despite poor performance.
constraints: Zero visibility into delivery journey after pickup
Can't identify root cause of delivery issues
No courier performance tracking or ratings
Restaurant blamed for platform's delivery failures
20-30% of deliveries late (>20 min past promise)
No escalation path for problem orders

agentic.workflow: 1. Tracking Agent monitors delivery in real-time: courier assignment, pickup time, GPS location, estimated delivery time. 2. Performance Metrics tracks each courier: on-time rate, customer ratings, average delivery time. 3. Delay Detection alerts when courier off-route or delayed: 'Courier has been stationary 15 min, order at risk'. 4. Auto-Escalation triggers support contact to customer: 'We see your order is delayed, investigating now'. 5. Courier Rating enables restaurant to flag poor performers for platform review.
benefits: 40-60% late delivery reduction through monitoring and escalation
Data to advocate with platforms for courier accountability

quickWins: Implement delivery tracking dashboard for staff
Enable automated customer alerts for delays
prerequisites: Delivery platform API access for tracking

label: Commission & Fee Management
description: Automated commission tracking and reconciliation with 99%+ accuracy reducing accounting overhead by 60-80% and identifying $2K-$5K monthly overcharges through intelligent auditing.

traditional.workflow: 1. Accountant manually downloads invoices from DoorDash, Uber Eats, Grubhub portals. 2. Accountant spot-checks calculations in Excel (checking 5-10% of line items). 3. Invoices paid without comprehensive verification. 4. Errors discovered months later if at all. 5. $2K-$8K in overcharges go undetected annually per location.
constraints: Manual invoice download and reconciliation (8-12 hours/month)
Spot-checking misses 90-95% of errors
No systematic commission rate verification
Overcharges discovered too late for recovery
$2K-$8K annual leakage per location
Multi-location franchises can't scale manual process

agentic.workflow: 1. Commission Tracking Agent auto-captures all order data: order value, fees, commission rates, promotional adjustments. 2. Reconciliation Engine compares platform invoices to actual orders line-by-line: '$347.82 DoorDash invoice vs $342.15 calculated (overcharge detected)'. 3. Discrepancy Alert flags errors: 'Uber Eats charged 28% commission instead of contracted 25% on 14 orders'. 4. Automated Dispute generates claim with supporting data for platform review. 5. Performance Dashboard shows commission trends and optimization opportunities.
dataSources: All order details (item prices, fees, commissions)
benefits: 60-80% accounting overhead reduction (2-3 hrs vs 8-12 hrs)
Real-time commission tracking not monthly retrospective

quickWins: Implement automated invoice reconciliation for top platform
Set up overcharge alerts for commission rate discrepancies
prerequisites: Platform invoice access via API or file

label: Virtual Brand Management (Ghost Kitchens)
description: Multi-brand operation from single kitchen with separate digital storefronts enabling 30-50% revenue increase through delivery-only brands with minimal incremental cost.

traditional.workflow: 1. Restaurant operates single brand (e.g., burger concept). 2. Kitchen capacity underutilized during off-peak (40-60% idle capacity). 3. Limited menu appeal (burger fans only). 4. Revenue capped by single brand's market share. 5. No way to test new concepts without opening new physical location.
constraints: Single brand limits addressable market
40-60% kitchen idle capacity during off-peak
Can't test new concepts without capital investment
Competition for same customer segment
No portfolio diversification (all eggs in one basket)
Menu innovation limited by brand identity

agentic.workflow: 1. Virtual Brand Platform enables multiple delivery-only concepts: main burger brand + virtual wing brand + virtual salad brand. 2. Shared Kitchen uses same equipment, staff, and ingredients across brands. 3. Separate Storefronts on delivery apps: customers see 3 different restaurant brands. 4. Unified Operations routes all orders to same kitchen with brand identifier. 5. Performance Analytics tracks each brand's P&L, enables portfolio optimization: shut down underperformers, double down on winners.
dataSources: Order volume by brand and daypart
benefits: Leverage existing kitchen capacity (minimal incremental cost)
Portfolio optimization based on performance data

quickWins: Launch 1 virtual brand using existing ingredients (wings or salads)
Test on DoorDash for 90 days before expanding

label: Delivery-Optimized Menu & Packaging
description: Menu engineering for delivery channel with specialized packaging reducing quality complaints by 50-70% and increasing repeat order rate 25-40% through superior delivery experience.

traditional.workflow: 1. Same menu offered for dine-in, drive-thru, and delivery. 2. Fries packed in standard container arrive soggy after 20-min delivery. 3. Burgers slide apart in transit, arrive messy. 4. Milkshakes melt, salads wilt, hot food arrives lukewarm. 5. 25-35% of delivery customers complain about food quality.
constraints: Dine-in menu not optimized for 20-30 min transit time
Standard packaging inadequate for delivery
25-35% quality complaints on delivery orders
Repeat order rate 40-60% lower than dine-in
Items removed from delivery menu due to quality issues
Temperature, texture, presentation degraded

agentic.workflow: 1. Menu Engineering Agent curates delivery-optimized menu: remove items that don't travel well (ice cream, delicate salads), feature items that hold heat/texture. 2. Specialized Packaging uses vented containers for fries (prevent sogginess), burger locks, insulated bags, separate hot/cold compartments. 3. Portion Adjustment optimizes serving size: slightly larger portions compensate for perceived value loss during delivery. 4. Assembly Modifications alters prep for delivery: sauces packaged separately, burgers wrapped tighter. 5. Quality Testing validates each item survives 30-min transit with acceptable quality.
benefits: 25-40% increase in delivery repeat order rate
Delivery menu tailored for travel vs dine-in

quickWins: Switch to vented fry containers to reduce sogginess
Package sauces separately to prevent burger sogginess
